sense.gloss: to taper to a point, to become pointed, to become sharp
to look displeased, to look sour, to be on edge, to be touchy
pointed end, tip, point, cusp (of a leaf, crescent moon, etc.), apex (of a curve)
sharp (pain, tone, etc.), acute, stabbing, cutting (remark, criticism, etc.), stinging, biting, fierce (attack), pointed (question, look, etc.), piercing (gaze), shrill (sound)
keen (intuition, sense of smell, etc.), acute, sharp (eye, mind, etc.), astute, shrewd, discerning, penetrating (insight, question, etc.), perceptive
cutting edge, leading edge, forefront, state of the art
naginata, polearm with a curved single-edged blade (similar to a glaive)
naginata, martial art of wielding the naginata
pulmonary apex, apex of a lung

r_ele.r: せんけいコンジローム

sense.gloss: genital warts, venereal warts, anal warts, condylomata acuminata
x: 尖圭コンジローマ・せんけいコンジローマ

shrew (any rodent of family Soricidae, esp. those of genus Sorex)
to sharpen (e.g. pencil), to pout (e.g. lips)

尖らせる・とがらせる・3

sdata.j: ↑遠↑↓とお↓くに↑教会↑↓きょうかい↓の↑尖塔↑↓せんとう↓が↑見↑↓み↓えた。
sdata.e: A church spire could be seen in the distance.

sdata.j: ↑彼女↑↓かのじょ↓の↑言↑↓い↓い↑方↑↓かた↓は↑私↑↓わたし↓の↑神経↑↓しんけい↓を↑尖↑↓とが↓らせる。
sdata.e: Her manner of speaking gets on my nerves.

sdata.j: きつつきは、↑長↑↓なが↓く↑尖↑↓とが↓ったくちばしで、↑木↑↓き↓の↑幹↑↓みき↓をつついて、↑中↑↓ちゅう↓にいる↑虫↑↓むし↓を↑食↑↓た↓べます。
sdata.e: Woodpeckers peck tree trunks with their long pointed beaks and eat insects found there.

sdata.j: ↑彼↑↓かれ↓はその↑棒切↑↓ぼうぎ↓れを↑狩猟↑↓しゅりょう↓ナイフで↑削↑↓けず↓り↑尖↑↓とが↓らせた。
sdata.e: He whittled the stick to a sharp point with his hunting knife.

sdata.j: ↑皿洗↑↓さらあら↓いをするように↑言↑↓い↓われ、↑彼女↑↓かのじょ↓は↑口↑↓くち↓を↑尖↑↓とが↓らせた。
sdata.e: She pouted when she was told to wash the dishes.
